title: What is the difference between an audio CD and a CD? Is there a difference? - Quora

response.answer_text: At one time there were CD Recorders that were produced for consumer use. In order for certain of these to be used, they required “Audio CD’s”. Because of the perceived loss of revenue from CD duplication, these recorders used the “Audio CD” which had a short encryption which allowed the CD to be recorded and these CD’s had paid an amount of money to copyright management such as BMI and ASCAP to reimburse the losses. A regular recordable CD (CDR) would work in computers and Professional CD recorders such as the HHB or top line TASCAM models. They would not work in the Marantz or TEAC versions of those recorders. “Audio” CD’s became a moot point with the general use of the computer CD burner which did not need the encryption band and would work with any CDR. There is no difference in the sound when played back either CD.

CD (Compact Disk) is kind of optical disk to store a data. CD-audio is CD, that contains digital audio data. Also CD can contains simultaneoulsy audio data and computer files.
